intro: Neoparrya lithophila, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central and western North America. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptability to harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually blue or violet, with three petals and three sepals. Neoparrya lithophila is often found in crevices and on cliff faces, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
